name: Idiopathic Giant Cell Myocarditis
chief_complaint: I feel like an elephant is sitting on my chest and I can't catch my breath
prognosis: guarded with high mortality without aggressive intervention; 75% mortality at 1 year without transplant
description: A rare, rapidly progressive form of myocarditis characterized by diffuse myocardial necrosis with multinucleated giant cells on histology. Often presents with fulminant heart failure and life-threatening arrhythmias. Distinct from lymphocytic myocarditis by its aggressive course and specific histopathology.
risk_factors: recent viral illness (though no causative link established)
